required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Therapeutic Effects of Continuous Theta Burst Stimulation in Autism Spectrum Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: To Explore the Therapeutic Effects of Continuous Theta-burst Stimulation Over Left Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex in Autism Spectrum Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator would like to investigate the impact of theta burst stimulation over left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex in autism spectrum disorder

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Social Responsiveness Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
primary_outcome.description: Social Responsiveness Scale can measure the autism clinical severity with the range from 65-260. The lower scores stand for better social responsiveness.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
primary_outcome.description: Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised is a questionnaire that focuses on repetitive behavior. The score ranges from 0-129. The lower scores stand for lower repetitive behavior.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Emotional Dysregulation Inventory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: Emotional Dysregulation Inventory is a parents' report questionnaire for emotional dysregulation. The score ranges from 0-120. The lower scores stand for better emotional regulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Adaptive Behavior Assessment System
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: Adaptive Behavior Assessment System is a parents' report questionnaire for adaptive behavior. The score ranges from 9-171. The higher scores stand for better adaptive behavior.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scales
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scales is a parents' report questionnaire for adaptive behavior. The score ranges from 0-484. The higher scores stand for better adaptive behavior.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in accuracy of Frith-Happe animation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: A quick and objective test of Theory of Mind. 8 questions in total, the more correct questions stand for better Social Cognition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in accuracy of Eyes task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: An advanced test for Theory of Mind. 43 questions in total, the more correct questions stand for better social skills.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in accuracy of Wisconsin Card Sorting Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: An advanced test for cognitive flexibility. 128 questions in total, the more correct questions stand for better cognitive flexibility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of total scores of Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function is a parents' report questionnaire for executive function. The score ranges from 86-258. The lower scores stand for better executive function.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline); One month follow up (4 weeks after post TBS)
secondary_outcome.description: An advanced test for for executive function. 60 questions in total, the more correct questions stand for better executive function.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: The Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule is a semi-structured assessment of communication, social interaction, and play (or imaginative use of materials) for individuals suspected of having autism spectrum disorders. The social affect domain includes the social and communication items ranging from 0 to 20. The higher scores stand for more clinical severity of autism spectrum disorder.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: functional MRI (resting-state/biological motion task) - BOLD signal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood-oxygen-level-dependent (BOLD) signal is a measurement used in fMRI, which reflects the neural activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; post TBS (8 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional anisotropy (FA) is a measurement used in DTI, which reflects the movement of water molecules. FA ranges from 0 to 1, the higher FA value may represent more intact axons.

arm_group.description: Participants received the real intervention of TBS (cTBS 600) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex for 8 weeks (2 days/week). *cTBS = continuous theta burst stimulation
Participants received the sham intervention of TBS (coil tilted one-wing 90° off the head) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex for 8 weeks (2 days/week).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- autism spectrum disorder, confirmed by ADOS
Exclusion Criteria:
- current and past systemic disease
- current and past major psychiatric disorders including schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder and major depressive disorder
- current and past brain injuries
- intelligence < 70
- seizure history
- pregnant
